CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 13, 1951, pg. 2 reads: "Anti-Litter Drive - Members of the Crime Prevention Club of R.L. Vann School, a branch club of Hill City, join Mr. Freehler, principal, and Carl Redwood of Hill City, in inspecting the first of a series of trash containers they will place on various corners to help get rid of sidewalk litter. Left to right: Mr. Freehler, Alfred Jefress, John Flippings, Carl Redwood, Shirley Hawthorne and Elizabeth Sharpe."
TitMainTitle: Crime Prevention Club members, from left: Mr. Freehler, Alfred Jefress, John Flippings, Carl Redwood Sr., Shirley Hawthorne, and Elizabeth (Ann) Sharpe (Haley), putting trash into garbage can inscribed "Please Help Crime Prevention Club Keep Our District Clean A Hill City Project," in front of Robert L. Vann Elementary School
